title: Cylinder Head - Installation

body.body: D series 1200 cc cylinder head Installation
Thoroughly clean the upper faces of the cylinder barrel.
Refit the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade. Ensure the lower mounting tip is correctly located in the upper crankcase and the lugs are located in the barrel as noted during removal.
Camshaft drive chain tensioner rubbing blade
Ensure that both cylinder head dowels are correctly located in the cylinder barrel.
Position a new cylinder head gasket to the cylinder barrel, ensuring the gasket is fitted with the lettering uppermost and to the rear of the engine.
Ensure the drive chain is fitted to the idler gear and located centrally on the tensioner blade.
Position the cylinder head over the camshaft drive chain rubbing blade and locate it onto the dowels.
Position the washers onto the new cylinder head bolts and lubricate the bolt threads with clean engine oil.
Use the correct procedure to tighten the cylinder head bolts carefully following the four-stage procedure below. This will ensure the long-term reliability of the cylinder head gasket.
Failure to follow the correct tightening procedure may lead to engine damage and premature failure of the cylinder head gasket.
In the following sequence, tighten the cylinder new head bolts in four stages as follows:
Tighten the bolts through a further
or similar to measure the torque-angle.
Carry out a torque over-check of the bolts to
Lubricate the valve shims with a 50/50 solution of molybdenum disulphide grease and engine oil, then refit them to their original locations in the cylinder head.

body.body: Install camshaft, camshaft cover, engine, fuel tank, battery, seat D74; DR4; DS4; DR5; DS5
Start the engine and allow it to idle while checking for air, oil, coolant and exhaust leaks.
